item.title: India’s Sarvam wants to bring its AI models to feature phones, cars and smart glasses
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The company is using edge models that take up only megabytes of space, can run on most phones with existing processors, and can work offline.

item.title: Heron Power raises $140M to ramp production of grid-altering tech
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Tesla alumni Drew Baglino raises a large round to build a giga-scale factory, this time at his own startup.

item.title: Indian AI lab Sarvam’s new models are a major bet on the viability of open-source AI
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The new lineup includes 30-billion and 105-billion parameter models; a text-to-speech model; a speech-to-text model; and a vision model to parse documents.

item.title: DG Matrix raises $60M to make data center power smarter
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The startup is making solid-state transformers capable of intelligently aggregating power from a number of different sources before sending it to data center racks.

item.title: U.S. court bars OpenAI from using ‘Cameo’
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: OpenAI has renamed its feature in Sora from "Cameo" to "Characters."

item.title: Tesla dodges 30-day suspension in California after removing ‘Autopilot’
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The decision comes a month after Tesla discontinued Autopilot, its basic driver-assistance system.

item.title: Intellexa’s Predator spyware used to hack iPhone of journalist in Angola, research says
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Amnesty International says it found evidence that a government customer of Intellexa, a sanctioned surveillance vendor, used its Predator spyware against a prominent journalist in Angola.

item.title: Jack Altman joins Benchmark as GP
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Jack Altman and Benchmark announced today that he would be joining the firm as a general partner.

item.title: Ford turns to F1 and bounties to build a $30,000 electric truck
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: A combination of 3D-printed Lego-like parts, Formula 1 thinking, and a bounty program will help the company hit that target. The team, led by Tesla veteran Alan Clarke, is obsessed with efficiency.

item.title: Meta’s own research found parental supervision doesn’t really help curb teens’ compulsive social media use
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: An internal research study at Meta found that parental supervision may not help teens regulate their social media, and teens with trauma are more inclined to overuse social media.

item.title: Apple is reportedly cooking up a trio of AI wearables
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: As the AI hardware space heats up, the iPhone maker has multiple smart products in development.

item.title: Thrive raises $10B for new fund, its largest yet
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Thrive Capital just raised $10 billion for its new fund -- nearly double the size of its last fund.

item.title: Climactic launches hybrid fund to get startups through the ‘valley of death’
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The new project, called Material Scale, will initially focus on climate tech startups in the apparel industry.

item.title: Anthropic releases Sonnet 4.6
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Anthropic has released a new version of its midsized Sonnet model, keeping pace with the company's four-month update cycle.

item.title: Mistral AI buys Koyeb in first acquisition to back its cloud ambitions
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Mistral AI has agreed to buy Koyeb, a Paris-based startup that simplifies AI app deployment at scale and manages the infrastructure behind it.

item.title: SpaceX vets raise $50M Series A for data center links
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: Mesh aims to mass-produce optical transceivers for AI data centers.

item.title: Running AI models is turning into a memory game
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: When we talk about the cost of AI infrastructure, the focus is usually on Nvidia and GPUs -- but memory is an increasingly important part of the picture.

item.title: European Parliament blocks AI on lawmakers’ devices, citing security risks
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: EU lawmakers found their government-issued devices were blocked from using the baked-in AI tools, amid fears that sensitive information could turn up on the U.S. servers of AI companies.

item.title: WordPress.com adds an AI Assistant that can edit, adjust styles, create images, and more
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The feature is designed to work inside the website to understand its content and layout, allowing site owners to make changes with natural language commands. The WordPress AI assistant doesn't need precisely tailored prompts, either.

item.title: These are the countries moving to ban social media for children
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Australia was the first country to issue a ban in late 2025, aiming to reduce the pressures and risks that young users may face on social media, including cyberbullying, social media addiction, and exposure to predators.
